page.title: 01General review of the block.
page.content: This block contains the northern end of Lake Derwentwater.Much of the well wooded shore line is owned by the National Trust and open to the public.Landing stages on the eastern side have rowing boats for hire and public launch services round the lake.The town of Keswick is a busy tourist centre in summer.It has many gift shops and a market on Saturday.The residential village of Portinscale is a pleasant walk from Keswick through fields and over the River Derwent by a metal suspension bridge.The north western corner of the block is low lying grass land for sheep and dairy farming, bordering on wet bog land.The eastern corner contains a hill called Latrigg.This is a foothill of Skiddaw,the third highest mountain in England.This is one of the best view points.
